intro: Cyrtopera, commonly known as the "spiny bladderpod," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are characterized by their distinctive, spiny pods and small, cruciform flowers. They are typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Cyrtopera species are often annual or biennial herbs, with leaves that are usually narrow and sometimes hairy. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
